post_text:
The South Dakota National Guard will rededicate the Watertown Readiness Center at 10:00 a.m. Sunday, October 2. This re-dedication ceremony will change the name of the Watertown Readiness Center to the
Brig. Gen. Ernie Edwards Readiness Center.
shared_text:
Watertown Area Chamber of Commerce
September 30, 2016 at 12:23 PM ·

The South Dakota National Guard will rededicate the
Watertown Readiness Center at 10:00 a.m.
Sunday, October 2. This rededication ceremony will change the name of the Watertown Readiness Center to the
Brig. Gen. Ernie Edwards Readiness Center.

The Watertown Area Chamber of Commerce has been
fortunate to have Ernie’s leadership and wisdom on
our Military Affairs Committee for the past decade.

Featured speakers will include Lt. Gov. Matt Michels, Maj.
Gen. Tim Reicsh, adjutant general of the SDNG and retired Maj. Gen. Donald Goldhorn, former adjutant general of the Guam National Guard and former assistant adjutant of the SDARNG.

We invite you to join the community in celebrating
this honor.

post_text:
The Watertown Quarterback Club, a Watertown High School athletics fundraising organization of approximately 100 members, will soon go by the name Arrow Booster Club.

According to the club’s secretary treasurer Chris Jacobson, the name change will go into effect beginning with the 2016-2017 academic year.

According to Jacobson, the current name gives it a skewed impression. Many Arrow fans of all sports tend to believe that the organization benefits solely the WHS football program, which is far from the truth. In fact, the Watertown Quarterback Club also donates its time and funds to all kinds of activities, not just sports. -- Watertown Public Opinion
shared_text:
WWW.THEPUBLICOPINION.COM
Watertown Quarterback Club to become Arrow Booster Club
text:
The Watertown Quarterback Club, a Watertown High School athletics fundraising organization of approximately 100 members, will soon go by the name Arrow Booster Club.

According to the club’s secretary treasurer Chris Jacobson, the name change will go into effect beginning with the 2016-2017 academic year.

According to Jacobson, the current name gives it a skewed impression. Many Arrow fans of all sports tend to believe that the organization benefits solely the WHS football program, which is far from the truth. In fact, the Watertown Quarterback Club also donates its time and funds to all kinds of activities, not just sports. -- Watertown Public Opinion

WWW.THEPUBLICOPINION.COM
Watertown Quarterback Club to become Arrow Booster Club

From the Watertown Public Opinion:
"A Native American powwow was held in the Watertown Middle School gym Saturday as part of graduation ceremonies for Native students.

School Supt. Dr. Lesli Jutting said this was the 10th year in a row the Watertown schools have hosted the powwow. Dancers came from all over the area, along with Native American drum groups."
-- Photos by Roger Whittle

post_text:
University of Nebraska men’s basketball coach Tim Miles felt right at home during his talk Sunday at a fundraising event for the Business, Industry, School Coalition (BISCO) of Watertown.

The crowd at Lake Area Technical Institute included many friends and relatives from his native Doland. The personable Husker coach kept the audience interested and entertained with stories from his childhood and his coaching career before taking questions from attendees.

Before heading back to Lincoln, Neb., Miles took time to meet and pose for pictures with nearly everyone in attendance.

BISCO, started in 1991 by then-Supt. Ernie Edwards, aims to enhance educational opportunities for students. -- Watertown Public Opinion

WWW.THEPUBLICOPINION.COM

post_text:
University of Nebraska head men’s basketball coach Tim Miles will be in Watertown this weekend to speak at a fundraising event for BISCO, the Business, Industry, School Coalition.

Miles will speak at the BISCO event, which begins at 4 p.m. on Sunday, May 8, on the fourth floor of the Lake Area Technical Insitute’s Student Center.

Light refreshments will be served and drawings will be held for autographed memorabilia, including copies of “Nebrasketball,” a book published in 2015 by former University of Nebraska journalism professor Scott Winter that chronicled that magical season and focuses on its young head coach.

Tickets are available to the BISCO event by calling the Watertown Public School’s superintendent’s office at 605-882-6312.

shared_text:
WWW.THEPUBLICOPINION.COM
Watertown icon Terry Redlin dies at 78

Watertown Area Chamber of Commerce
April 25, 2016 at 10:45 AM ·

Terry Redlin, the nationally known wildlife artist who was born and raised in Watertown, died Sunday at age 78.

Undoubtedly the nation’s premier wildlife artist, Redlin was named time and again the nation’s best wildlife artist and best artist of the year by Ducks Unlimited, the National Wildlife Art Collectors Society and U-S Art magazine, among others.

A 1955 graduate of Watertown High School, Redlin cemented his legacy by building the impressive Redlin Art Center on a hill near the intersection of U.S. Highway 212 and Interstate 29. The center holds more than 160 of his original paintings in addition to prints, sketches and childhood drawings. It has become a cultural landmark for the area. -- Watertown Public Opinion
